fields.value: Data for PLOS One PONE-D-14-56298R1 paper
Effects of Early Bilingual Experience with a Tone and a Non-Tone Language on Speech-Music Integration

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Demographics.xlsx: includes Age in Years, Ravens score, Digit Span score, Number of Languages taught, Music training in months, Group (CON=control, BIL=bilingual).
This contains the data for the Dutch controls and the Cantonese-Dutch bilinguals that were included in the analyses.

Music Questionnaire.xlsx: includes the self report on Music education duration, Ability to read notes, favorite types of music, whether they've ever composed music, time spent listening to music, and how, attendance of music concerts, reading music magazines, whether they work in a music related job/environment, whether they have family/friends that are musicians, whether they think they sing in tune, and whether they are tone deaf.

Language History Q.xlsx: includes answers to the Language History Questionnaire by Li, Sepanski & Zhao (2006).

Detection_DigitSpan.xlsx: includes total number of Detection errors, Digit Span score, Group. Only subjects that completed the Detection task AND Digit Span are included.

Discrimination_DigitSpan.xlsx: includes total number of Discrimination errors, Digit Span score, Group. Only subjects that completed the Discrimination task AND Digit Span are included.

TransposedSequence_DigitSpan.xlsx: includes total number of Transposed Tone Sequence errors, d prime score, Group, Digit Span score. Only subjects that completed the Transposed Tone Sequence task AND Digit Span are included.

SimpleSequence_DigitSpan.xlsx: includes total number of Transposed Tone Sequence errors, d prime score, Group, Digit Span score. Only subjects that completed the Transposed Tone Sequence task AND Digit Span are included.

VowelInterval_Accuracy.xlsx: non-aggregate accuracy data per subject, in a format ready for glme4. It includes trial number, task, condition, the name of the wav file played, the response (1=correct, 2=incorrect), subject de-identified ID, group, digit span score (NA=Not available). Only subjects with non-corrupted vowel-interval identification task data are included, among them, control subjects recruited especially for this task.

PitchIntervalIdentificationTask_Accuracy.xlsx: non-aggregate accuracy data per subject, in a format ready for glme4. It includes trial number, trialID, image presented (Red, Yellow, Blue squares), Interval type (P5=perfect 5th, P4=perfect 4th, M2= minor 2nd), reference pitch (F4# or C4), the correct button number, the response given, the coding into correct/incorrect (1=correct, 0=incorrect), RT=reaction time, subject  de-identified ID, group, digit span score (NA=Not available). Only subjects that completed the pitch interval training identification task data are included.

RhythmPatternIdentificationTask_Accuracy.xlsx: non-aggregate accuracy data per subject, in a format ready for glme4. It includes trial number, trialID, image presented (Green, Purple, Orange squares), Pattern type, Tempo, the response given, the correct button number, the coding into correct/incorrect (1=correct, 0=incorrect), RT=reaction time, subject  de-identified ID, group, digit span score (NA=Not available). Only subjects that completed the rhythm pattern training identification task data are included.

publicationCitation.value: Asaridou SS, Hagoort P, McQueen JM (2015) Effects of Early Bilingual Experience with a Tone and a Non-Tone Language on Speech-Music Integration. PLoS ONE 10(12): e0144225. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0144225
